intro: Pistolochia × hausmannii, commonly known as the hybrid yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its natural distribution.
